div.p: Like all things with Splunk. There's not always one hard and fast rule...
tstats with data models are great. But there are some edge cases where it might actually be better to have multiple searches. (Yes... I know... I said this was bad...)
The edge cases are usually where you want to split the tstats data by another field.
In this example, we look at splitting the data by sourcetype, as this contains the year.
The faster method actually turns out to be multiple searches, as we have 'pre computed' this in our data model with different child nodes.

panel.title: Single Base Search with Tstats (eval(match())) : Total Search Time : $tok_step_1_total_duration$ sec

search.query: | tstats summariesonly=t count from datamodel=drivestats_acc where nodename=all by sourcetype,all.model | stats distinct_count(eval(if(match('all.model',"(?i)^HGST.+"),'all.model',null()))) as dc_hgst distinct_count(eval(if(match('all.model',"(?i)^Hitachi.+"),'all.model',null()))) as dc_hitachi distinct_count(eval(if(match('all.model',"(?i)^WDC.+"),'all.model',null()))) as dc_wdc distinct_count(eval(if(match('all.model',"(?i)^ST.+"),'all.model',null()))) as dc_st distinct_count(eval(if(match('all.model',"(?i)^SAMSUNG.+"),'all.model',null()))) as dc_samsung distinct_count(eval(if(match('all.model',"(?i)^TOSHIBA.+"),'all.model',null()))) as dc_toshiba by sourcetype | rex field=sourcetype "drivestats:(?<year>\d{4})" | fields - sourcetype

pre.span: | tstats summariesonly=t count from datamodel=$tok_dm$ where nodename=all by sourcetype,all.model

panel.title: Multi Base Search with Tstats (eval(match())) : [Combined Search Time : $tok_step_2_total_duration$ sec] | [Max Search Time: $tok_step_2_max_duration$ sec] | Min Search Time: $tok_step_2_min_duration$ sec]

search.query: | tstats summariesonly=t count from datamodel=$tok_dm$ where nodename=all.2014 by all.model | stats distinct_count(eval(if(match('all.model',"(?i)^HGST.+"),'all.model',null()))) as dc_hgst distinct_count(eval(if(match('all.model',"(?i)^Hitachi.+"),'all.model',null()))) as dc_hitachi distinct_count(eval(if(match('all.model',"(?i)^WDC.+"),'all.model',null()))) as dc_wdc distinct_count(eval(if(match('all.model',"(?i)^ST.+"),'all.model',null()))) as dc_st distinct_count(eval(if(match('all.model',"(?i)^SAMSUNG.+"),'all.model',null()))) as dc_samsung distinct_count(eval(if(match('all.model',"(?i)^TOSHIBA.+"),'all.model',null()))) as dc_toshiba

| tstats summariesonly=t count from datamodel=$tok_dm$ where nodename=all.2015 by all.model | stats distinct_count(eval(if(match('all.model',"(?i)^HGST.+"),'all.model',null()))) as dc_hgst distinct_count(eval(if(match('all.model',"(?i)^Hitachi.+"),'all.model',null()))) as dc_hitachi distinct_count(eval(if(match('all.model',"(?i)^WDC.+"),'all.model',null()))) as dc_wdc distinct_count(eval(if(match('all.model',"(?i)^ST.+"),'all.model',null()))) as dc_st distinct_count(eval(if(match('all.model',"(?i)^SAMSUNG.+"),'all.model',null()))) as dc_samsung distinct_count(eval(if(match('all.model',"(?i)^TOSHIBA.+"),'all.model',null()))) as dc_toshiba

| tstats summariesonly=t count from datamodel=$tok_dm$ where nodename=all.2016 by all.model | stats distinct_count(eval(if(match('all.model',"(?i)^HGST.+"),'all.model',null()))) as dc_hgst distinct_count(eval(if(match('all.model',"(?i)^Hitachi.+"),'all.model',null()))) as dc_hitachi distinct_count(eval(if(match('all.model',"(?i)^WDC.+"),'all.model',null()))) as dc_wdc distinct_count(eval(if(match('all.model',"(?i)^ST.+"),'all.model',null()))) as dc_st distinct_count(eval(if(match('all.model',"(?i)^SAMSUNG.+"),'all.model',null()))) as dc_samsung distinct_count(eval(if(match('all.model',"(?i)^TOSHIBA.+"),'all.model',null()))) as dc_toshiba

| tstats summariesonly=t count from datamodel=$tok_dm$ where nodename=all.2017 by all.model | stats distinct_count(eval(if(match('all.model',"(?i)^HGST.+"),'all.model',null()))) as dc_hgst distinct_count(eval(if(match('all.model',"(?i)^Hitachi.+"),'all.model',null()))) as dc_hitachi distinct_count(eval(if(match('all.model',"(?i)^WDC.+"),'all.model',null()))) as dc_wdc distinct_count(eval(if(match('all.model',"(?i)^ST.+"),'all.model',null()))) as dc_st distinct_count(eval(if(match('all.model',"(?i)^SAMSUNG.+"),'all.model',null()))) as dc_samsung distinct_count(eval(if(match('all.model',"(?i)^TOSHIBA.+"),'all.model',null()))) as dc_toshiba

| tstats summariesonly=t count from datamodel=$tok_dm$ where nodename=all.2018 by all.model | stats distinct_count(eval(if(match('all.model',"(?i)^HGST.+"),'all.model',null()))) as dc_hgst distinct_count(eval(if(match('all.model',"(?i)^Hitachi.+"),'all.model',null()))) as dc_hitachi distinct_count(eval(if(match('all.model',"(?i)^WDC.+"),'all.model',null()))) as dc_wdc distinct_count(eval(if(match('all.model',"(?i)^ST.+"),'all.model',null()))) as dc_st distinct_count(eval(if(match('all.model',"(?i)^SAMSUNG.+"),'all.model',null()))) as dc_samsung distinct_count(eval(if(match('all.model',"(?i)^TOSHIBA.+"),'all.model',null()))) as dc_toshiba
